title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

One point for each of the following explanations/ identifications

· Difference between introns and exons

· Description of splicing

· 5′ cap added or description of function

· 3′ poly A tail added or description of function
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

One point for each of the following explanations/ identifications

· Difference between introns and exons

· Description of splicing

· 5′ cap added or description of function

· 3′ poly A tail added or description of function

Student response earns one of the available points.
One point for each of the following explanations/ identifications

· Difference between introns and exons

· Description of splicing

· 5′ cap added or description of function

· 3′ poly A tail added or description of function

Student response earns two of the available points.

One point for each of the following explanations/ identifications

· Difference between introns and exons

· Description of splicing

· 5′ cap added or description of function

· 3′ poly A tail added or description of function

Student response earns three of the available points.

One point for each of the following explanations/ identifications

· Difference between introns and exons

· Description of splicing

· 5′ cap added or description of function

· 3′ poly A tail added or description of function

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
6 points maximum

One point for each of the following explanations/identifications

· Description of the role of tRNA in the transport of amino acids

· Description of the ribosome/rRNA

· Peptide bond formation (or the connecting of amino acids into a polypeptide chain)

· Concept of codon-anticodon binding

· Concept of the role of the genetic code (e.g., mRNA bases determine the sequence of amino acids)

· Description of stages (initiation, elongation, and termination)

· Elaboration point for a detailed explanation—examples of acceptable answers include, but are not limited to, the following:

▪ Description of 40S and 60S ribosomal subunits

▪ Role of aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase

▪ Structure of tRNA

▪ Use of GTP as energy source

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

One point for each of the following explanations/identifications:

· Role of chaperones in folding a polypeptide into the protein

· Modification of the protein or addition of sugars and/or phosphate

· Concept of the endomembrane system (description of protein moving from ER to Golgi to vesicles)

· Exocytosis through the fusion of the vesicle with the cell membrane
descriptions:
